trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing app (Xamarin.Android) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing app (Xamarin.Android) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to store and access data from your Azure Mobile Services Xamarin.Android app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to store and access data from your Azure Mobile Services Xamarin.Android app.

trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing app
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to leverage data in a Xamarin.Android app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to leverage data in a Xamarin.Android app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the mobile service with the app, and then login to the Azure Management Portal to view changes to data made when running the app.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the mobile service with the app, and then login to the Azure Management Portal to view changes to data made when running the app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to use Azure to store and retrieve data from a Xamarin.Android app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to use Azure to store and retrieve data from a Xamarin.Android app.

trans-unit.source: As such, this topic walks you through many of the steps that are completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: As such, this topic walks you through many of the steps that are completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services](/develop/mobile/tutorials/get-started-xamarin-android).
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services](/develop/mobile/tutorials/get-started-xamarin-android).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:

trans-unit.source: [Download the Xamarin.Android app project][GitHub]
trans-unit.target: [Download the Xamarin.Android app project][GitHub]

trans-unit.source: [Create the mobile service]
trans-unit.target: [Create the mobile service]

trans-unit.source: [Add a data table for storage]
trans-unit.target: [Add a data table for storage]

trans-unit.source: [Update the app to use Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Update the app to use Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [Test the app against Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Test the app against Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A9C9624B5"%20target="_blank).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A9C9624B5"%20target="_blank).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the [Azure Mobile Services Component], [Xamarin.Android], and Android SDK 4.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the [Azure Mobile Services Component], [Xamarin.Android], and Android SDK 4.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The downloaded GetStartedWithData project requires targetting Android 4.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The downloaded GetStartedWithData project requires targetting Android 4.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: However, the Mobile Services SDK requires only Android 2.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: However, the Mobile Services SDK requires only Android 2.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: Download the GetStartedWithData project
trans-unit.target: Download the GetStartedWithData project

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is built on the [GetStartedWithData app][GitHub], which is a Xamarin.Android app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is built on the [GetStartedWithData app][GitHub], which is a Xamarin.Android app.

trans-unit.source: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services Android quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.
trans-unit.target: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services Android quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.

trans-unit.source: Download the `GetStartedWithData` sample app and extract the files on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Download the `GetStartedWithData` sample app and extract the files on your computer.

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio, click **File** then **Open**, browse to where you extracted the GetStartedWithData sample project, and select **XamarinTodoQuickStart.Android.sln** and open it.
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio, click **File** then **Open**, browse to where you extracted the GetStartedWithData sample project, and select **XamarinTodoQuickStart.Android.sln** and open it.

trans-unit.source: Locate and open the **TodoActivity** class
trans-unit.target: Locate and open the **TodoActivity** class

trans-unit.source: Notice that there are `// TODO::` comments that specify the steps you must take to make this app work with your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Notice that there are `// TODO::` comments that specify the steps you must take to make this app work with your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu, click **Start Without Debugging**, you will then be asked to pick an emulator or attached USB Android device.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu, click **Start Without Debugging**, you will then be asked to pick an emulator or attached USB Android device.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You can run this project using an Android phone, or using the Android emulator.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You can run this project using an Android phone, or using the Android emulator.

trans-unit.source: Running with an Android phone requires you to download a phone-specific USB driver.
trans-unit.target: Running with an Android phone requires you to download a phone-specific USB driver.

trans-unit.source: To run the project in the Android emulator, you must define a least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).
trans-unit.target: To run the project in the Android emulator, you must define a least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).

trans-unit.source: Use the AVD Manager to create and manage these devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the AVD Manager to create and manage these devices.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the saved text is stored in an in-memory collection and displayed in the list below.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the saved text is stored in an in-memory collection and displayed in the list below.

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Add a new table to the mobile service
trans-unit.target: Add a new table to the mobile service

trans-unit.source: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table.
trans-unit.target: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Data** tab, then click **+Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Data** tab, then click **+Create**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the **Create new table** dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **Create new table** dialog.

trans-unit.source: In **Table name** type _TodoItem_, then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: In **Table name** type _TodoItem_, then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new storage table **TodoItem** with the default permissions set, which means that any user of the app can access and change data in the table.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new storage table **TodoItem** with the default permissions set, which means that any user of the app can access and change data in the table.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The same table name is used in Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The same table name is used in Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: However, each table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.
trans-unit.target: However, each table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.
trans-unit.target: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.

trans-unit.source: Click the new **TodoItem** table and verify that there are no data rows.
trans-unit.target: Click the new **TodoItem** table and verify that there are no data rows.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Columns** tab and verify that there is only a single **id** column, which is automatically created for you.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Columns** tab and verify that there is only a single **id** column, which is automatically created for you.

trans-unit.source: This is the minimum requirement for a table in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This is the minimum requirement for a table in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When dynamic schema is enabled on your mobile service, new columns are created automatically when JSON objects are sent to the mobile service by an insert or update operation.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When dynamic schema is enabled on your mobile service, new columns are created automatically when JSON objects are sent to the mobile service by an insert or update operation.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.

trans-unit.source: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access
trans-unit.target: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access

trans-unit.source: Now that your mobile service is ready, you can update the app to store items in Mobile Services instead of the local collection.
trans-unit.target: Now that your mobile service is ready, you can update the app to store items in Mobile Services instead of the local collection.

trans-unit.source: If you don't already have **Azure Mobile Services** listed in the Components folder, you can get it by right-clicking **Components**, choosing **Get More Components** and then searching for **Azure Mobile Services**.
trans-unit.target: If you don't already have **Azure Mobile Services** listed in the Components folder, you can get it by right-clicking **Components**, choosing **Get More Components** and then searching for **Azure Mobile Services**.

trans-unit.source: This adds the Mobile Services SDK component to the project.
trans-unit.target: This adds the Mobile Services SDK component to the project.

trans-unit.source: Open the **AndroidManifest.xml** file and ensure the following permission line exists:
trans-unit.target: Open the **AndroidManifest.xml** file and ensure the following permission line exists:

trans-unit.source: This enables the app to access Mobile Services in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This enables the app to access Mobile Services in Azure.

trans-unit.source: From the **Solution** window, open the **TodoActivity** class, and uncomment the following line of code:
trans-unit.target: From the **Solution** window, open the **TodoActivity** class, and uncomment the following line of code:

trans-unit.source: We will remove the in-memory list currently used by the app, so we can replace it with a mobile service.
trans-unit.target: We will remove the in-memory list currently used by the app, so we can replace it with a mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the **TodoActivity** class, comment out the following line of code, which defines the existing **todoItemList** list.
trans-unit.target: In the **TodoActivity** class, comment out the following line of code, which defines the existing **todoItemList** list.

trans-unit.source: Once the previous step is done, the project will indicate build errors.
trans-unit.target: Once the previous step is done, the project will indicate build errors.

trans-unit.source: Search for the three remaining locations where the `todoItemList` variable is used and comment out the sections indicated.
trans-unit.target: Search for the three remaining locations where the `todoItemList` variable is used and comment out the sections indicated.

trans-unit.source: We now add our mobile service.
trans-unit.target: We now add our mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Uncomment the following lines of code:
trans-unit.target: Uncomment the following lines of code:

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Dashboard** tab and make a note of the **Site URL**, then click **Manage keys** and make a note of the **Application key**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Dashboard** tab and make a note of the **Site URL**, then click **Manage keys** and make a note of the **Application key**.

trans-unit.source: You will need these values when accessing the mobile service from your app code.
trans-unit.target: You will need these values when accessing the mobile service from your app code.

trans-unit.source: In the **Constants** class, uncomment the following member variables:
trans-unit.target: In the **Constants** class, uncomment the following member variables:

trans-unit.source: Replace **AppUrl** and **AppKey** in the above variables with the values retrieved from the Management Portal above.
trans-unit.target: Replace **AppUrl** and **AppKey** in the above variables with the values retrieved from the Management Portal above.

trans-unit.source: In the **OnCreate** method, uncomment the following lines of code that define the **MobileServiceClient** variable:
trans-unit.target: In the **OnCreate** method, uncomment the following lines of code that define the **MobileServiceClient** variable:

trans-unit.source: This creates a new instance of MobileServiceClient that is used to access your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new instance of MobileServiceClient that is used to access your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: It also creates the MobileServiceTable instance that is used to proxy data storage in the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: It also creates the MobileServiceTable instance that is used to proxy data storage in the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Find the ProgressFilter class at the bottom of the file and uncomment it.
trans-unit.target: Find the ProgressFilter class at the bottom of the file and uncomment it.

trans-unit.source: This class displays a 'loading' indicator while MobileServiceClient is running network operations.
trans-unit.target: This class displays a 'loading' indicator while MobileServiceClient is running network operations.

trans-unit.source: Uncommment these lines of the **CheckItem** method:
trans-unit.target: Uncommment these lines of the **CheckItem** method:

trans-unit.source: This sends an item update to the mobile service and removes checked items from the adapter.
trans-unit.target: This sends an item update to the mobile service and removes checked items from the adapter.

trans-unit.source: Uncommment these lines of the **AddItem** method:
trans-unit.target: Uncommment these lines of the **AddItem** method:

trans-unit.source: This code creates a new item and inserts it into the table in the remote mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This code creates a new item and inserts it into the table in the remote mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Uncommment these lines of the **RefreshItemsFromTableAsync** method:
trans-unit.target: Uncommment these lines of the **RefreshItemsFromTableAsync** method:

trans-unit.source: This queries the mobile service and returns all items that are not marked as complete.
trans-unit.target: This queries the mobile service and returns all items that are not marked as complete.

trans-unit.source: Items are added to the adapter for binding.
trans-unit.target: Items are added to the adapter for binding.

trans-unit.source: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for backend storage, it's time to test the app against Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for backend storage, it's time to test the app against Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Test the app against your new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the app against your new mobile service

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu, click **Start Without Debugging** to start the project.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu, click **Start Without Debugging** to start the project.

trans-unit.source: You will be asked to pick an existing emulator image or an attached USB Android device.
trans-unit.target: You will be asked to pick an existing emulator image or an attached USB Android device.

trans-unit.source: This executes your app, built with Xamarin.Android, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This executes your app, built with Xamarin.Android, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: As before, type meaningful text, then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: As before, type meaningful text, then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Data** tab, then click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Data** tab, then click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the **TodoItem** table now contains data, with id values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the **TodoItem** table now contains data, with id values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.

trans-unit.source: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial for Xamarin.Android.
trans-unit.target: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial for Xamarin.Android.

trans-unit.source: Get completed example
trans-unit.target: Get completed example

trans-unit.source: Download the [completed example project].
trans-unit.target: Download the [completed example project].

trans-unit.source: Be sure to update the **applicationURL** and **applicationKey** variables with your own Azure settings.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to update the **applicationURL** and **applicationKey** variables with your own Azure settings.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Xamarin.Android app to work with data in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Xamarin.Android app to work with data in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials that is based on the GetStartedWithData app that you created in this tutorial:
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials that is based on the GetStartedWithData app that you created in this tutorial:

trans-unit.source: [Validate and modify data with scripts]
trans-unit.target: [Validate and modify data with scripts]

trans-unit.source: Learn more about using server scripts in Mobile Services to validate and change data sent from your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about using server scripts in Mobile Services to validate and change data sent from your app.

trans-unit.source: [Refine queries with paging]
trans-unit.target: [Refine queries with paging]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use paging in queries to control the amount of data handled in a single request.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use paging in queries to control the amount of data handled in a single request.

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed the data series, try these other Xamarin.Android tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed the data series, try these other Xamarin.Android tutorials:

trans-unit.source: [Get started with authentication]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with authentication]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authenticate users of your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authenticate users of your app.

trans-unit.source: [Get started with push notifications]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with push notifications]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
